intro: Urostigma tecolutense, commonly known as the Mexican whitebeard. It is a flowering plant native to Mexico, belonging to the Malvaceae family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a distinctive yellowish-green color. Urostigma tecolutense is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or limestone soils.
